thread.title: DanielClark published Car left wedged in hedge after collision with lorry on the M5

author: DanielClark
title: DanielClark published Car left wedged in hedge after collision with lorry on the M5
text:
Car left wedged in hedge after collision with lorry on the M5 By DanielClark | Posted: June 27, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES The car is barely visible in the hedge Car left wedged in hedge after collision with lorry on the M5 X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
This picture shows the wreckage of a car after it collided with a lorry on the M5 on Tuesday afternoon. The incident happened on the M5 near junction 27 in Devon at 2.55pm. 
Police say that a car and lorry collided after the car crossed from the northbound to the southbound carriageway and then left the road down a bank. 
The incredible pictures of a wrecked car wedged upside down in a hedge have been posted online as a warning to "tired drivers". 
The Road Policing Alliance tweeted: "Moral of the story stop and take a break before you fall asleep and come off the road. Luckily no one hurt." Moral of the story stop and take a break before you fall asleep and come off the road. Luckily no one hurt. 4578 M5 pic.twitter.com/vGiYvXHzc2 â€” Alliance RPT (@RoadPolAlliance) June 27, 2017 
A police spokesman has confirmed that the driver of the car has suffered minor injuries. 
One lane remained closed as of 5.30pm for recovery of the vehicle. Read more Hard and Soft Brexit are meaningless - we need a good Brexit:... 
Fire crews were also called to the accident after the car went down a bank. 
The fire service report read: "Crews from Cullompton and Tiverton were mobilised to reports of an RTC persons trapped at M5 southbound between junctions 27 and 28. 
"On arrival crews discovered one RTC involving a lorry and a car. The car had left the motorway and was down a bank in a field. There was no one trapped. 
"Crews made the vehicles safe."
